main_definition: The ordinal number that comes after the sixth in a series or sequence, representing one of seven equal parts into which something can be divided.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ordinal number signifying the seventh position
meanings_and_examples.example: In the race, he finished in seventh place.

meanings_and_examples.definition: One of seven equal parts or divisions
meanings_and_examples.example: If you divide a pizza into sevenths, each slice represents one seventh of the whole pie.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A biblical and historical reference to the Seventh Day (Saturday) as a day of rest
meanings_and_examples.example: Many people observe the Sabbath on Saturday, which is also known as the 'seventh' or 'sabbath' day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in music to denote one seventh interval from the root note
meanings_and_examples.example: In C major, an F natural would be a 'major seventh' above the root C note.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An age or stage of development corresponding to being in one’s seventh year (of life) or seven years old
meanings_and_examples.example: Seventeen-year-old Emily just started high school, which is her 'seventh' grade.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in sports to denote the seventh round of a tournament
meanings_and_examples.example: In the Wimbledon tennis tournament, there are 128 players who compete over seven rounds or 'sevenths' before reaching the final.
